text: The 2001–02 League of Ireland First Division season was the 17th season of the League of Ireland First Division. ==Overview== The First Division was contested by 10 teams and Drogheda United won the division. The 2002–03 season would see the League of Ireland First Division expanded from 10 to 12 teams. As a result the runners-up, Finn Harps F.C. were not automatically promoted as in previous seasons. ==Final table== ==Promotion/Relegation Play-off== Second placed Finn Harps played off against Longford Town who finished in ninth place in the 2001–02 League of Ireland Premier Division. The winner would compete in the 2002–03 League of Ireland Premier Division. === 1st Leg === === 2nd Leg === Longford Town win 6-5 on penalties after extra time and retain their place in the Premier Division. ==See also== * 2001–02 League of Ireland Premier Division ==References== Category:League of Ireland First Division seasons Category:2001–02 in Republic of Ireland association football Ireland
title: 2001–02 League of Ireland First Division
